document_data.name: Summon Shadow
document_data.Effects: The shadows summoned by this spell were under the control of the caster, and could be used to attack foes. Such conjured creatures would remain for a length of time proportional to the power of the caster (a minimum of six minutes), or until they were [[Turn undead|turned]] or killed. The creatures appeared in a {{SIAdj|10|ft|long=yes}} cube at a range of up to {{SI|10|yd|long=yes}} from the caster.
document_data.Components: This spell required [[verbal]], [[somatic]], and [[material component]]s. The material component was a small piece of [[smoky quartz]].
document_data.History:
The spell was invented in the {{YearlinkName|-594}}, by the [[Netherese]] [[arcanist]], known as [[Telamont Tanthul|Shadow]], with the original name being '''''Shadow's summons'''''.

In the month of [[Eleasis]], of the {{YearlinkName|1371}}, the city of [[Ravens Bluff]]'s [[Ministry of Art]] and [[Wizards Guild]] jointly declared it illegal to cast ''summon shadow'' within city limits due to a raging unnatural storm at the time called the [[Soulstorm]]. In addition to threatening arrest for those that broke this decree, it was declared that breaking this prohibition would result in a permanent expulsion from either organization.{{Cite trumpeter/2-8|2}}{{LCRB}}
document_data.Users: ''Summon shadows'' was used by casters with access to the [[Negative Energy plane]] in order to summon [[dread wolf|dread wolves]], as well as—rarely—[[sha'ir]]s of [[Zakhara]].<ref>
